docs.lead_paragraph: The $6.4 billion measure reverses a 21 percent cut in physician payments that had raised the possibility that some doctors might begin to turn away those covered by Medicare.

headline.main: House Passes Plan to Stop Medicare Cuts to Doctors
headline.print_headline: House Passes Plan to Stop Medicare Cuts to Doctors

docs.snippet: The $6.4 billion measure reverses a 21 percent cut in physician payments that had raised the possibility that some doctors might begin to turn away those covered by Medicare.

headline.main: Can I Add My Adult Stepchild to My Plan?

docs.abstract: Virtually any adult child under age 26 may remain on her parents' insurance plan beginning this fall.
docs.snippet: Virtually any adult child under age 26 may remain on her parents' insurance plan beginning this fall.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve's policy-making arm said on Wednesday that it had decided to keep short-term interest rates near zero for "an extended period," citing challenges to economic growth, including the effect of new financial troubles abroad, Christine Hauser reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Fed Leaves Rates Unchanged, Citing Overseas Threats

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
